entry.string: IE7 is a module that emulates better CSS support (such as in Internet Explorer 7) for visitors using IE 5.0, 5.5 or 6.0

Microsoft Internet Exporer 5, 5.5 and 6.0 has poor support for many CSS2 standards and even completely breaks the standards in some earlier versions (e.g. faulty box model). Dean Edwards has written a fantastic script called ie7 which uses mostly Javascript to fix these defects, and this is the Xaraya-ized version of his work.
Dean's script can be found at

First, check your theme to make sure your head javascript appears before any css is loaded. eg the tag <xar:base-render-javascript position="head" /> should appear before any css in your main page templates.
Third, add all those CSS features you've been holding back on for years!
Further information on the ie7 module can be found at
Click on Version History tab at the bottom to get the latest release information.
Related tutorials and documentation on ie7 found at
